results.title: Criminology Student Is Charged in 4 University of Idaho Killings

results.byline: By Jim Tankersley, Susanne Craig and Russ Buettner
results.title: Key Takeaways From Trump’s Tax Returns
results.abstract: Former President Donald J. Trump, who fought for years to keep his returns private, made no charitable donations in 2020, and his own tax law may have cost him. Here’s a running list of insights.

media.caption: Former President Donald J. Trump and other Republicans raised the threat of retaliation for Democrats’ release of his tax returns.
media.copyright: Ash Adams for The New York Times

results.title: Trump Tax Returns Undermine His Image as a Successful Entrepreneur
results.abstract: The release of former President Donald J. Trump’s private tax documents by the House Ways and Means Committee shows heavy losses from his own ventures as he continued to cash in on inherited assets.

results.byline: By Alessandra Stanley
results.title: Barbara Walters, a First Among TV Newswomen, Is Dead at 93
results.abstract: She broke barriers for women as a co-host of the “Today” show, a network evening news anchor and a creator of “The View,” all while gaining her own kind of celebrity.

media.caption: Barbara Walters in 1976. Her rise to stardom in the 1960s and 1970s signaled a cultural shift.

results.byline: By Grace Ashford and Dana Rubinstein
results.title: Santos, a Suburban House and $11,000 in Campaign Payments for ‘Rent’
results.abstract: Representative-elect George Santos, under scrutiny after fabricating much of his résumé, also spent campaign funds on $40,000 worth of air travel.

media.caption: George Santos’s campaign spent funds on air travel, out-of-state hotels and pricey restaurants in New York, but also elsewhere, as he sought to represent a section of Queens and Long Island.

results.title: Andrew Tate Is Charged With Human Trafficking and Rape in Romania
results.abstract: Mr. Tate, an online personality known for making misogynistic comments, and three others will be held in custody for 30 days, the authorities said.

media.caption: Andrew Tate was escorted outside the headquarters of the Directorate for the Investigation of Organized Crime and Terrorism in Bucharest, Romania, on Thursday.

results.title: Vivienne Westwood, 81, Dies; Brought Provocative Punk Style to High Fashion
results.abstract: The London shop she ran with Malcolm McLaren defined an era. “I don’t think punk would have happened,” Chrissie Hynde said, “without Vivienne and Malcolm.”

media.caption: The designer Vivienne Westwood at her boutique in London in 1977. The shop went through many name changes; it was known as Seditionaries at the time.

results.abstract: A police officer at Nashville International Airport told travelers whose Southwest flights had been canceled that they would be arrested for trespassing if they did not leave a secure area, a video shows.
